summary.para: Creates a range object from two ACP values.

param.name: acpStart
param.para: Contains the starting position of the range.

param.name: acpEnd
param.para: Contains the ending position of the range.

param.name: ppRange
param.para: Pointer to an interface pointer that receives the range object.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Forces all values of an asynchronously loaded property to be loaded.

param.name: pProp
param.para: Pointer to an object that specifies the property to load.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: When calling this method, the application must be able to grant a synchronous read-only lock.

summary.para: Obtains a property from a range of text and writes the property data into a stream object.

param.name: pProp
param.para: Pointer to an interface that identifies the property to serialize.

param.name: pRange
param.para: Pointer to an interface that identifies the range that the property is obtained from.

param.name: pHdr
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives the header data for the property.

param.name: pStream
param.para: Pointer to an IStream object that the TSF manager will write the property data to.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: The property header data placed in pHdr is generic to all properties and must be preserved with the data written into pStream. This same data pair must be passed to to restore the property data.
An application can save all of the properties for the entire document by performing the following steps.

item.description: Within each property, enumerate the ranges using .
Pass the current property and range to ITextStoreACPServices.Serialize.
Write the data placed in pHdr to the file.
Write the data added to pStream to the file.

remarks.para: When calling this method, the application must be able to grant a synchronous read-only lock.

summary.para: Takes previously serialized property data and applies it to a property object.

param.name: pProp
param.para: Pointer to an object that receives the property data.

param.name: pHdr
param.para: Pointer to a structure that contains the header data for the property.

param.name: pStream
param.para: Pointer to an IStream object that contains the property data. This parameter can be NULL if pLoader is not NULL. This parameter is ignored if pLoader is not NULL.

param.name: pLoader
param.para: Pointer to an object that the TSF manager will use to obtain the property data. This parameter can be NULL if pStream is not NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The property data will be obtained asynchronously.
A synchronous read-only lock cannot be obtained.

remarks.para: If pStream is specified rather than pLoader, the property data will be read from pStream during the call to Unserialize . If pLoader is specified rather than pStream, the property data will be read from pLoader asynchronously. Using pStream can cause long delays if the property data is large.
While calling this method, the application must be able to grant a synchronous read-only lock.

summary.para: The ITextStoreACPServices interface is implemented by the TSF manager to provide various services to an ACP-based application. To obtain an instance of this interface, an application calls QueryInterface on the punk parameter passed to with IID_ITextStoreACPServices.
